14
15#ifndef ISC_REGION_H
16#define ISC_REGION_H 1
17
18/*! \file isc/region.h */
19
20#include <isc/types.h>
21#include <isc/lang.h>
22
23struct isc_region {
24 unsigned char * base;
25 unsigned int length;
26};
27
28struct isc_textregion {
29 char * base;
30 unsigned int length;
31};
32
33/* XXXDCL questionable ... bears discussion. we have been putting off
34 * discussing the region api.
35 */
36struct isc_constregion {
37 const void * base;
38 unsigned int length;
39};
40
41struct isc_consttextregion {
42 const char * base;
43 unsigned int length;
44};
45
46/*@{*/
47/*!
48 * The region structure is not opaque, and is usually directly manipulated.
49 * Some macros are defined below for convenience.
50 */
51
52#define isc_region_consume(r,l) \
53 do { \
54 isc_region_t *_r = (r); \
55 unsigned int _l = (l); \
56 INSIST(_r->length >= _l); \
57 _r->base += _l; \
58 _r->length -= _l; \
59 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
60
61#define isc_textregion_consume(r,l) \
62 do { \
63 isc_textregion_t *_r = (r); \
64 unsigned int _l = (l); \
65 INSIST(_r->length >= _l); \
66 _r->base += _l; \
67 _r->length -= _l; \
68 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
69
70#define isc_constregion_consume(r,l) \
71 do { \
72 isc_constregion_t *_r = (r); \
73 unsigned int _l = (l); \
74 INSIST(_r->length >= _l); \
75 _r->base += _l; \
76 _r->length -= _l; \
77 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
78/*@}*/
79
80ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
81
82int
83isc_region_compare(isc_region_t *r1, isc_region_t *r2);
84/*%<
85 * Compares the contents of two regions
86 *
87 * Requires:
88 *\li 'r1' is a valid region
89 *\li 'r2' is a valid region
90 *
91 * Returns:
92 *\li < 0 if r1 is lexicographically less than r2
93 *\li = 0 if r1 is lexicographically identical to r2
94 *\li > 0 if r1 is lexicographically greater than r2
95 */
96
97ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
98
99#endif /* ISC_REGION_H */
100
